ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Question on Loot and Classes
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, at level 35 there s not really a piercer that s better for a rogue to use.  Keep in mind, rogues only need to have a piercer in their primary hand to be
ygData.messageBody:
Well, at level 35 there's not really a piercer that's better for a rogue to
use. Keep in mind, rogues only need to have a piercer in their primary hand
to be able to backstab, the off hand has nothing to do with it. If I was a
level 35 rogue, I'd certainly use an ebw in my off hand. Lots of rogues use
yaks in their off hands too until they get planar gear.


Elwyn

-----Original Message-----
From: Adam Wasserman [mailto:wassermana@...]
Sent: Wednesday, April 05, 2000 11:07 AM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: [eqbards] Question on Loot and Classes


Hi all,

Last night I ended up camping the maid and butler in MM. Our severely
overpowered group consisted of 2 bards (35), 1 rogue (35), 1 warrior (35), 1
druid (35) and 1 shaman (33). During the night we were fortunate to see the
Butler once, and he actually had the fang for us. I didn't win the lotto. :┬¼
(

Anyway, our rogue said that he needed the EBW too. I was wondering what all
of your opinions on the matter were. I would love some ammo for my side of
the argument that there are other things he should be going after. Of
course, if I'm wrong, then I guess that means I'll be in MM a looooooong
time.

*does some quick math, 4 x 4 = 16.*

Eep, we need 8 fangs as a group?

*runs off to cry*

Draelon Stormsong
